snippet: Evidence suggests that President Xi Jinping has been pushing his family to sell hundreds of millions of dollars in holdings in an effort to reduce his political vulnerability.
abstract: New evidence suggests Chinese Pres Xi Jinping has been pushing his own family to sell hundreds of millions of dollars in investments, as he prepares to tackle biggest cases of official corruption in more than six decades of Communist Party rule; review of records shows Xi's sister Qi Qiaoqiao and brother-in-law Deng Jiagui sold investments in at least 10 companies from 2012 until 2014.
lead_paragraph: Evidence suggests that President Xi Jinping has been pushing his family to sell hundreds of millions of dollars in holdings in an effort to reduce his political vulnerability.

headline.main: As China’s Leader Fights Graft, His Relatives Shed Assets
headline.print_headline: Kin Shed Assets as China’s Leader Fights Graft

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations
